title: Fix PED error
body:
### Description of the bug

```
Caused by:
  Process `CMGG_CMGGGERMLINE:CMGGGERMLINE:ADD_PED_HEADER:RTGTOOLS_PEDFILTER (Proband)` terminated with an error exit status (1)

Command executed:

  rtg pedfilter \
      --vcf \
      Proband.samples.tsv \
  | rtg bgzip  - > Proband.vcf.gz
  
  
  cat <<-END_VERSIONS > versions.yml
  "CMGG_CMGGGERMLINE:CMGGGERMLINE:ADD_PED_HEADER:RTGTOOLS_PEDFILTER":
      rtgtools: $(echo $(rtg version | head -n 1 | awk '{print $4}'))
  END_VERSIONS

Command exit status:
  1

Command output:
  (empty)

Command error:
  WARNING: DEPRECATED USAGE: Forwarding SINGULARITYENV_TMPDIR as environment variable will not be supported in the future, use APPTAINERENV_TMPDIR instead
  WARNING: DEPRECATED USAGE: Forwarding SINGULARITYENV_NXF_DEBUG as environment variable will not be supported in the future, use APPTAINERENV_NXF_DEBUG instead
  Error: Conflicting PED definitions of sex for individual -9

```

title: Haplotypecaller is overprovisioned
body:
### Description of the bug

Haplotypecaller is set to `process_medium` after which the setting are overrided in `modules.conf` to increase time and set cpu's to 1

This causes the job to request too much memory.
I suggest setting to `process_single` which _should_ be enough for single chunks (pending execution report)

title: Possible improvement to vep

xref https://github.com/nf-core/modules/pull/3006#issuecomment-1462109031

Perhaps we _could_ merge all vcf's into a multisample per run, then run `vep` and split again. That way, we only need to run vep once, or once per chunk.

title: automap single sample analysis - Execution halted error
body:
### Description of the bug

for the single sample analysis, following error is present in log file:
```Error in file(file, "rt") : cannot open the connection
Calls: read.table -> file
In addition: Warning message:
In file(file, "rt") :
  cannot open file 'automap_haplotypecaller//.HomRegions.pdf': No such file or directory
Execution halted
```
in result output dir are only the `.tsv` files present, but without DNA-number in name and no `.pdf` file is present:
- .HomRegions.cmgg_bio.tsv
- .HomRegions.strict.cmgg_bio.tsv
- .HomRegions.tsv



### Command used and terminal output

If following command is executed on HPC, the result is correct `automap_latest.sif automap --vcf Proband_*-gatk4-haplotype-joint-decomposed-annotated.vcf.gz --out /outputdir/ --genome hg38 --repeats repeats_hg38.bed --panel Biomodule_20220808_all_genes_hg38.txt --panelname cmgg_bio`

title: UPDio: generate also output files when no UPD's are found
body:
### Description of feature

Current situation (based on WES run reanalysis): only output file generation when UPD's are detected (~ `*.upd` file is not empty and there is a `*events_plot.png` generated)

Request: also generate output files ( `*.upd` , `*table`, `*event_list`) when no UPD's are detected (~ `*.upd`file is empty and no `*events_plot.png` is generated)

title: Restructure output directory
body:
### Description of feature

The output directory should be restructured to allow incremental file writing in the same directory over multiple runs.

```
<params.outdir>
  - <pipeline_version>_<date> => Contains pipeline run specific files
  - <family1>
    - <sample1>_<pipeline_version>_<date> => contains all sample specific files
    - <sample2>_<pipeline_version>_<date>
    - joint_<pipeline_version>_<date> => contains all family specific files
    - qc_<pipeline_version>_<date> => contains all qc for the family specific files (multiqc)
  - <family2>
  - ...
```

A separate multiqc should be created for the whole run and separately for each family.
